intro: Calea discolor, commonly known as the white ghostflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking white petals and unique, intricate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its flowers are nocturnal, opening at night and closing by morning, which is a rare trait among flowering plants. Calea discolor is also noted for its medicinal properties, used traditionally by indigenous communities for various health purposes.
